alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN PINE, SOUTHWESTERN DOUGLAS AND NORTHEASTERN BURNETT COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM CDT... At 730 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Duxbury, or 14 miles east of Hinckley, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mille Lacs Band Lena Lake Area around 735 PM CDT. Duxbury around 740 PM CDT. Webster and Danbury around 750 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Webb Lake Wisconsin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for east central Minnesota...and northwestern Wisconsin.
